intro: Eschscholzia clevelandii, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and delicate foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The California poppy is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
